steps.description: Customer initiates an ISA transfer request by selecting the provider, entering account details, and confirming transfer type.
steps.businessRationale: Initiation requires regulatory disclosures, provider lookup, and validation of ISA eligibility. Smooth UX reduces abandonment and increases transfer completion likelihood.

steps.description: Customer signs digital transfer authority forms and HL submits the request to the existing ISA provider.
steps.businessRationale: Digital signatures and regulatory confirmations require secure workflows. This step is critical for legal compliance and transfer acceptance.

steps.description: The existing ISA provider processes the transfer request, validates holdings, and prepares funds for movement.
steps.businessRationale: ISA transfers typically take 1–2 weeks depending on provider responsiveness. HL must track SLAs and notify customers of delays.

steps.description: Funds are transferred from the old provider to HL, either as cash or re-registered assets.
steps.businessRationale: Settlement and reconciliation require coordination between custodians. Delays directly impact customer satisfaction and AUM growth.

steps.description: HL confirms transfer completion, updates the customer’s ISA balance, and sends notifications.
steps.businessRationale: Timely confirmation improves trust and reduces support queries. This step triggers AUM recognition for HL.

steps.description: Customer reviews transferred funds, explores investment options, and may set up recurring investments.
steps.businessRationale: Portfolio review is a high‑value engagement moment that drives future trades, recurring investments, and long-term retention.
